Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bead in the shape of an eye
Description: Only the ''white'' of the eye and the pupil are depicted. The iris is painted in black. This bead was only meant to be seen from the front since it is endowed with two suspension rings at the top and bottom of the eye. See L 1017 (b).
